title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Orange, purple and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted to cardboard
inscribed:
Recto: ingraphite upper center: bracket marking length of repaet and "repeat"; in graphite across lower edge [arrow] and "warp"; in graphite at right edge: bracket with "1/24", "satin" and "rep" with indicators to the design ; in graphite lower right corner, 9[underlined]; and a square and an "x" inscribed in a circle lightly sketched 

Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 27; in graphite left side: 1 11/16 . 8 on 13 1/2; in graphite lower right: 73 49 qual/ 96 pks  88 wh
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Geometric pattern incorporating bands of diamonds, diamonds with quatrafoil centers and squares with center circles. The color bands form vertical stripes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Orange, purple and yellow colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted to cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-445.
